entry.title: Niall Ó Glacáin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Irish physician Niall Ó Glacáin (pictured) worked as a travelling plague doctor in southern France in the 1620s?

entry.title: race for Auckland Central in 2020 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Chlöe Swarbrick won the race for Auckland Central in 2020, during which she held a drag show as a campaign event?

entry.title: Jehovah's Witnesses in Singapore (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that many Jehovah's Witnesses in Singapore have been imprisoned for refusing to serve in the military?

entry.title: Max Greyserman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that PGA Tour golfer Max Greyserman and his brother Reed are the first brothers to win the New Jersey Amateur Championship?

entry.title: many African countries provide for legal abortion (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that many African countries provide for legal abortion in their reproductive health laws, but such laws have been passed without grounds for legal abortion in Madagascar and in Senegal?

entry.title: Mariano R. Vázquez (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mariano R. Vázquez oversaw the integration of anarchists into the government during the Spanish Civil War?

entry.title: The Power of Babel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the author of The Power of Babel says that speakers of Swedish, Norwegian, and Danish are all speaking the same language?

entry.title: Cooper Mays (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in college, football player Cooper Mays was a member of the same offensive line as his brother?

entry.title: Jyocho (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the music of math rock band Jyocho has been alternatively described as akin to "madness" or "contemplative and melancholy"?
